name: Orchid
description: Colombia has the greatest variety of orchids in the world. They grow in humid forests and are known for their vibrant colors and delicate shapes.

name: Guayacán Tree
description: The Guayacán is famous for its bright yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season, covering entire landscapes with color.

name: Frailejón
description: Frailejones grow in high-altitude páramos and help store water in their thick leaves, playing a vital role in Colombia’s water ecosystem.

name: Heliconia
description: Heliconias are tropical plants with striking red, orange, and yellow bracts. They attract hummingbirds and thrive in humid climates.

name: Coffee Plant
description: Coffee plants are one of Colombia´s most important crops. They grow in mountainous regions and require consistent rainfall.

name: Wax Palm
description: The Wax Palm is Colombia’s national tree and the tallest palm species in the world, found in the Cocora Valley.

name: Bougainvillea
description: Bougainvillea is known for its bright pink and purple bracts. It thrives in warm climates and requires little water.

name: Bromeliad
description: Bromeliads often grow attached to trees and collect water in their leaves. They are common in Colombian rainforests.

name: Ceiba Tree
description: The Ceiba is a massive tropical tree considered sacred in many indigenous cultures. It can grow extremely tall.

name: Passion Flower
description: The passion flower produces beautiful complex blooms and is also the source of passion fruit.

name: Cacao Plant
description: Cacao trees produce the beans used to make chocolate. They grow best in warm and humid climates.

name: Guadua Bamboo
description: Guadua is a strong bamboo species used in sustainable construction throughout Colombia.

name: Rose of Castile
description: A popular ornamental flower cultivated in Colombia’s flower industry and exported worldwide.

name: Areca Palm
description: The Areca Palm is commonly used as an ornamental plant in warm areas and indoor spaces.

name: Mangrove
description: Mangroves grow in coastal ecosystems and protect shorelines while providing habitat for many species.
